title: Five fun things for kids over the school holidays
text:
Five fun things for kids over the school holidays Last updated 12:04, July 9 2015 
Kids can dress as their favourite characters for the Frozen Singalong Movie Rerun in Gore. 
1. Wellington: Feel the rhythm 
Kids can get into the groove at Beat it!, a performance by Strike Percussion, then have a go at being percussionists themselves. 
The show will be followed by all-ages workshops where participants get the chance to grab the sticks and play. 
The free performance is on Saturday, July 18, 10.30am, with two workshops ($8 per child) from 11.30am. Capital E, 4 Queens Wharf, 18 July. Bookings essential for the workshops. See capitale.org.nz . 
2. Taupo: The wizard returns 
A fun night for fans of Harry and his friends, this event will feature questions and activities based on Harry Potter & the Philosopher's Stone, the first novel in the series by J.K. Rowling. 
Dress up as your favourite character and make up a team of four, or join one on the night. The Harry Potter Family Quiz Night is a free, all-ages event, 6-8pm. Taupo Public Library, Story Place, July 16. See taupodc.govt.nz . 
3. Gore: Frozen fever 
Add fuel to the fever for Frozen at this singalong movie session. Kids are encouraged to dress to the theme, with prizes for best dressed boy and girl. 
The Frozen Singalong Movie Rerun is a fundraiser for Gore Kids Hub. St James Theatre, 61 Irk St, July 18, 2pm. Tickets $12.50 or three for $30. See sbsstjamesgore.co.nz . Ad Feedback 
4. Dunedin: Mad science 
Budding science and tech geeks can navigate a laser maze and play with laser beams at Luminescence: The Spectrum of Science. 
Run by physics students, the fair is a celebration of the International Year of Light 2015, and will feature interactive demonstrations and scientists working on cutting-edge light-based science and technology research. University of Otago, July 18, 10am-4pm, free. See quantum.otago.ac.nz/luminescence2015 . 
5. Hastings: Snowed in 
Truckloads of snow will be dumped in a massive igloo for Become A Star Snow Day in Civic Square. 
Kids can play in the Snow Park, grab a snag at the free sausage sizzle, and watch the finals of the Become A Star talent quest. 
Hip hop dance lessons, book readings and hands-on art sessions are being held inside at the art gallery and library. Eastbourne St, July 18, 10am-2pm, free. See becomeastar.co.nz . - Stuff
